title: How to See Bumble Matches Without Paying

steps.title: Open Bumble.
steps.content: Open Bumble. This app icon looks like a beehive on a yellow background. You can also go to https://bumble.com/ if you'd rather use your computer.

steps.title: Tap the chat bubble icon.
steps.content: Tap the chat bubble icon. It's in the lower right corner of your screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Look through the "Match Queue.
steps.content: Look through the "Match Queue. " Profiles that you've "liked" and have "liked" you back will appear here. [2] X Research source How to Get More Matches on Bumble has plenty of tips that will help you get matches.

steps.title: Open your Bumble matches in Chrome on your computer.
steps.content: Open your Bumble matches in Chrome on your computer. This trick will only work if you're using a computer to access Bumble. If Bumble figures out this workaround, they might make changes so it no longer works. Try it while you can!

steps.title: Press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+J (PC) or ⌘ Command+⌥ Option+J (Mac).
steps.content: Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + J (PC) or ⌘ Command + ⌥ Option + J (Mac). This opens your Chrome developer console.

steps.title: Click the Network tab.
steps.content: Click the Network tab. It's at the top of the right panel. If you don't see it, click the two sideways arrows >> at the top to expand more options.

steps.title: Refresh the page
steps.content: Refresh the page . You can do so by clicking the curved arrow at the top of Chrome or by right-clicking a blank area of the page and selecting Reload . Now you'll see several URLs in the right panel. If you don't see anything in the "Name" section, double-check to make sure there is nothing typed into the "Filter" field above it.

steps.title: Click the special URL.
steps.content: Click the special URL. Scroll through the options under "Name" until you find /mwebapi.phtml?SERVER_GET_ENCOUNTERS . You may need to make the window larger to find it. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Response tab.
steps.content: Click the Response tab. This is parallel to the "Name" field in the right panel.

steps.title: Copy the information
steps.content: Copy the information in the Response box. To make sure you get everything in the box, click inside the box and press Control + A (PC) or Command + A (Mac) to highlight everything, and then press Control + C (PC) or Command + C (Mac) to copy.

steps.title: In another browser tab, open an online JSON reader.
steps.content: In another browser tab, open an online JSON reader. A simple fast option is https://jsonviewer.stack.hu/ .

steps.title: Right-click the blank area in the JSON reader and select Paste.
steps.content: Right-click the blank area in the JSON reader and select Paste . This pastes a big chunk of text with assorted URLs into the reader. If this doesn't work for you, you can also paste it by clicking in the typing area and pressing Control + V (PC) or Command + V (Mac).

steps.title: Click the Viewer tab in the JSON reader.
steps.content: Click the Viewer tab in the JSON reader. This organizes that mess of data into something you can browse.

steps.title: Navigate to the ClientEncounters/Results menu.
steps.content: Navigate to the ClientEncounters/Results menu. Once you do this, you'll have a list of potential matches. Here's how: Expand the body menu. Expand the 0 menu. Expand the ClientEncounters menu. Expand the Results menu, where you'll find a set of folders numbered from 0 to 9 .

steps.title: Expand all of the numbered folders.
steps.content: Expand all of the numbered folders. To do this, just click the + next to each of the numbers. Under each number, you'll see another folder called user . [4] X Research source The information you're looking for is in the user folder. Each of these numbered folders represents the first 10 people in your queue.

steps.title: Expand the first user folder.
steps.content: Expand the first user folder. The name and age will match up with the person that's active in your match list. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Look at the value of "has_user_voted" above the user folder.
steps.content: Look at the value of "has_user_voted" above the user folder. The value will either be true or false . [6] X Research source If the value is true , the user probably liked you—to confirm, look for match_message in their user menu. If you see "They like you too! Now X has 24 hours to message you, the person definitely liked you. If the value is false , the either didn't swipe right. This could mean they haven't seen you yet, but it also could mean they swiped left. You can now repeat this process for the next 10 people in your queue.
